intro: Oreoselinum majus, commonly known as the giant parsley, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and dill, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. Oreoselinum majus grows up to 1.5 meters tall, making it one of the tallest members of its family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and stream banks.
